subNodes.conversationText: root

Greetings, friend. Would you like to come in and join our discussion? We have some exotic beverages to share. My associate and I are keen on intellectual discourse about current events and all wordly matters. I am Lord Randolph, and I sit on the council of merchants in this city. Allow me to introduce...
Continue

Professor Karter. I hold position on the board of directors at the Academy and Library. Guiding the minds of Khyn's young citizens is my objective. We all have so much to learn and discover. However I am afraid there is a limit to the knowledge that can be gleaned behind these fortified walls.
Any particular subject you two have been debating?

As a matter of fact, we were just discussing the hold that the Monastery has over the city and theocratic rule. Might it not be time for another class to assume power? Not by violent means, oh no, but perhaps a move toward shared responsibilities and control. I say, do you suppose you might be interested in joining our efforts?
Tell me what you have in mind.

We have given the matter some thought, and the best way to diminish the influence of Thespar Wordsmith would be to discover some scandal. Something that would embarrass him, and cause those who surround the Abbot to force him to step down. At the same time, the people will consider giving more power for the merchants to run the city.
Continue

Back at the Castle, I have noticed the Abbot spends much time fixated on a torch on the west side of the entry hall. I am certain it functions as a lever to open a secret passage. You see, Thespar Wordsmith is keeping secrets. And you can take the first step in helping our movement by uncovering his clandestine activity.
We will see what can be done, but no promises. Farewell.
No thank you, I am not interested.

We understand. A shame, really, that you do not wish to get involved. But any ensuing power struggle always has the potential to get messy. Our intentions are as peacefull as can be, I assure you. So if you change your mind and would like to learn more, feel free to stop by.
I will not enter into such a conflict lightly. Farewell.
I would like to hear more of these exotic beverages.

Well, my little friend, this particular brand is a vintage imported from the independent city of Saldanus, outside the Kingdom's borders. As such, it is quite rare and expensive. I might be enticed to sell you a bottle or two.
Continue
That is not important right now, Randolph. We should get back to disucssing the matter at hand. Now is the time for us to sew the seeds of action.
Continue

Quite so, quite so. And I wonder if our friends here would be interested in joining our efforts. You see, in Khyn, the Monastery... and by extension, Abbot Wordsmith... wields absolute power. Might it not be time for others to assume the mantle of rulership? A change of leadership. Not through violent means, but perhaps a move toward shared responsibilities and control.
Tell me what you have in mind.

We have given the matter some thought, and the best way to diminish the influence of Thespar Wordsmith would be to discover some scandal. Something that would embarrass him, and cause those who surround the Abbot to force him to step down. At the same time, the people will consider giving more power for the merchants to run the city.
If your thirst is for power, then I see no difference.

Then your sight is limited, and you are intellectually uncurious. I can promise you, our intentions are for a bloodless revolution. The time has come to put a more enlightened council at the head of this city. Should you reconsider your position, we might have further use for you.
I have heard enough for now. Farewell.
Guiding minds, or more like indoctrination.

Now then, <Sir/Madam> Dwarf, such skepticism is unbecoming. Could we not say the same of the Monastery and the iron grip upon thought the Abbot holds? My associate and I were just discussing the possibility of a shift in power. Perhaps it is time for the noble class to rule. An educated, benevolent aristocracy to work for the better of our citizens. Can you find fault with that?
Say no more, count me in!

We have given the matter some thought, and the best way to diminish the influence of Thespar Wordsmith would be to discover some scandal. Something that would embarrass him, and cause those who surround the Abbot to force him to step down. At the same time, the people will consider giving more power for the merchants to run the city.
And what's wrong with the way things are run in the city?

Well... truth be told, it would seem things are being handled competently from outside appearances. Under the protection of the King, we flourish, and coin flows into the city. However, we cannot help but wonder that things could be even better if more reasonable-minded persons were in charge.
I have heard enough for now. Farewell.
You gentlemen wouldn't happen to know about illegal goods being smuggled into the city, would you?

What is that? I have no idea what you imply. You see, this is exactly the concern we have been talking about. It sounds like the Monastery or one of their minions is going around making things difficult for lawfully abiding merchants. The next thing you know, our goods are confiscated. Well, I can tell you that I have all the proper import and export documents in order.
Continue

Lord Randolph, get a hold of yourself. Of course your trade conduct is above reproach, there is nothing to make you agitated. No accusation has been leveled against you, they are only using their minds to inquire. Such persons who have an interest to discover truth, could be very helpful to us. Perhaps they would listen to our proposition.
Tell me what you have in mind.
Hello again. Do let us know if you find anything about Thespar Wordsmith.
Farewell.
I've changed my mind, and wish to hear your plan.

We have given the matter some thought, and the best way to diminish the influence of Thespar Wordsmith would be to discover some scandal. Something that would embarrass him, and cause those who surround the Abbot to force him to step down. At the same time, the people will consider giving more power for the merchants to run the city.
Continue

Back at the Castle, I have noticed the Abbot spends much time fixated on a torch on the west side of the entry hall. I am certain it functions as a lever to open a secret passage. You see, Thespar Wordsmith is keeping secrets. And you can take the first step in helping our movement by uncovering his clandestine activity.
We will see what can be done, but no promises. Farewell.

When you walk through this open door, there is no sign of any residents. In fact, further exploration through the rooms shows evidence of a ransacking. Furniture is knocked over, desks and cabinets thoroughly searched. Documents litter the floor.
It appears the professor and the merchant have been dealt with.
Hello again. Do let us know if you find anything about Thespar Wordsmith.
Farewell.
